answers.answer: Hi,There is a possibility that you are suffering from migraine. You can try OTC painkillers for your headache. Polyneuropathy can be simply because of vitamin deficiency or diabetes. I suggest you to get your blood sugar test done. Normal MRI is a positive sign. I would suggest you get a vision test done as well. Good luck!

question: Can anyone please help  I am a 30 y/o female with unilateral headaches of the left side. Head and scalp senstive to touch visual disturbances dizziness ans some nausea when headache is at it worse. Normal MRI results positive nerve conduction test for polyneuropathy. Cause of headache still unknow seeing neurologists currently taking trileptal for pain. Can anyone help. Thanks,
title: L side headache with peripheral neuropathy
